Articles.Content: I'm sure a lot of you have seen this flick but, was that one awesome ship or what?! The scenes of the ship entering the atmosphere of the planet (or moon), and then landing were just awesome! the big pivoting engines and all just impressed the hell out of me. Don't you wish you could build something like that with KSP? I know it's only a pipe dream but, damn!

Mmmm, it did sort of look cool. But my brain was going: THAT'S NOT HOW PHYSICS WORK1!1! Because it was flying straight without even rotating the engines... not to mention it dosen't look the most aerodynamic...

Mmmm, it did sort of look cool. But my brain was going: THAT'S NOT HOW PHYSICS WORK1!1! Because it was flying straight without even rotating the engines... not to mention it dosen't look the most aerodynamic...

its as aerodynamic as a mountain moving at mach 2

and the physics thing...maybe if they were moving fast enough.

from the schematics, they are massive ion engines, so they could have been accelerating for a LONG time.
It was not the wrong area and you are horribly inaccurate!
I would voice my opinion of Prometheus, but since the forum software censors language, it would just be a page of asterisks.
Kinda interested to see what happens to Shaw after it ends.

It seems ok, although the hard SF fanatics would throw rocks at it.

The elephant alien being a human-like alien was quite unexpected, to be honest.
